result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Fuchs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Defendant to complete a psychological examination and follow through with recommendations. No contact with drug dealers or users. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

10:57 AM Defendant Matthew J Fuchs in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III in court for Matthew J Fuchs.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 22CF929 Cts 3, 4 & 5- GUILTY. 
22CF795 Ct 1 GUILTY. 
22CF812 GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaints. 
BTC: 22CF929 Cts 3, 4 & 5 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 22CF795 Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 22CF812 GUILTY. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
22CF929-
60 days Racine County Jail on each count to run concurrent. SERVED. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Mandatory Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, payment plan $25/month commencing 12/1/2022.

22CF795-
Sentence withheld. 
2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
90 days STAYED. 
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
Psychological evaluation completed and follow through on recommendations. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
No contact with drug dealers or users. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.

Mandatory Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Expert Testimony, by the State.
Pretrial Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with victim store D and D Industrial Coating except for restitution purposes.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew J Fuchs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Matthew J Fuchs. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
